notes.text:
Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.2.1 is now available for download from the Customer Portal.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.2 is a standalone server, based on the Keycloak project, that provides authentication and standards-based single sign-on capabilities for web and mobile applications.

This release of Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.2.1 serves as a replacement for Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.2.0, and includes several bug fixes and enhancements. For further information, refer to the Release Notes linked to in the References section.

Security Fix(es):

* hotrod client: unchecked deserialization in marshaller util (CVE-2016-0750)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.2.1 security update

notes.text: The hotrod java client in infinispan automatically deserializes bytearray message contents in certain events. A malicious user could exploit this flaw by injecting a specially-crafted serialized object to attain remote code execution or conduct other attacks.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: client: unchecked deserialization in marshaller util
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

vulnerabilities.title: client: unchecked deserialization in marshaller util

cwe.name: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')

notes.text: It was found that with non-clean TCP close, Websocket server gets into infinite loop on every IO thread, effectively causing DoS.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: undertow: IO thread DoS via unclean Websocket closing
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

vulnerabilities.title: undertow: IO thread DoS via unclean Websocket closing

notes.text: It was found that the Hotrod client in Infinispan would unsafely read deserialized data on information from the cache. An authenticated attacker could inject a malicious object into the data cache and attain deserialization on the client, and possibly conduct further attacks.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: infinispan: Unsafe deserialization of malicious object injected into data cache
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

Reason: This candidate is a duplicate of CVE-2015-9251.  Notes: All CVE users should reference CVE-2015-9251 instead of this candidate.
